fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-24045].
  {panel}

Currently "Export to PDF" in Space Administration creates a PDF with its order based on hierarchy levels from high to low. For example, in a space with the following structure:

* Home
** Major Branch A
*** Minor Branch
** Major Branch B

If "Minor Branch" and "Major Branch B" are selected to be exported, "Major Branch B" would actually be displayed first in the resulting PDF, since it is at a higher level than the "Minor Branch" (2nd versus 3rd). In other words, Confluence looks from the root to the next major branch that is selected, rather than generating the PDF top-down.

While this is logical, it may not be the way users expect PDF exports to work. It would be nice to add an option to generate the PDF based on the order displayed within Confluence, despite the pages' hierarchy level. When such an option is selected, the PDF generated in example above would have "Minor Branch" come before "Major Branch B", since it appears first in top-down.
fields.summary: Add option to sort exported PDF by displayed order when space is partially selected

fields.description:
Confluence has a built-in component for connecting to other remote systems via HTTP (the HttpRetrievalService). Internally, this is built on top of the Apache Commons HttpClient ([http://hc.apache.org]).

Some user-facing components of Confluence, such as the JIRA Issues Macro, depend on this service to connect to remote systems and retrieve data for display.

There is a bug/limitation in the current version of Confluence's HttpRetrievalService that makes it unable to communicate with remote servers configured to use HTTPS that only accept SSLv3 as the encryption algorithm.
fields.summary: Allow Confluence to integrate over HTTPS with remote systems secured with SSLv3

fields.description:
Confluence supports use of custom authenticators in Confluence 4.0.x, but when using a custom authenticator, a customer reports that the LOGININFO table is not being updated.

It is unclear to me what must be done in the custom authenticator to ensure that LOGININFO is updated successfully when using our custom authenticator.
(Please add Erkki Aalto to ticket who is customer having this issue.)

This is not a request for assistance with the authenticator or in developing it, but a question of whether this is a bug in Confluence 4.0.x/Embedded Crowd when used with custom authenticators in-general, or whether the documentation for developing Confluence custom authenticators could include a brief summary of how to use Atlassian APIs in a custom Confluence authenticator to ensure that this LOGININFO table can be updated properly for user login auditing functionality that is assumed to be supported in Confluence 4.0.

If this turns out to be a support issue, I apologize in advance. Basically, it would be nice if someone with familiarity in this part of Confluence/Embedded Crowd can ensure that this should work properly even when a custom Confluence authenticator is in use and that nothing special has to be done in the authenticator for it to work, especially considering that Erkki has posted a log fragment showing that Confluence does indeed attempt to update the table.

This issue has been documented in this two locations:
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/21460/how-to-update-logininfo-table-in-confluence-4-0-in-custom-confluence-authenticator
https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/browse/SHBL-50
fields.summary: Confluence 4.0.x does not update LOGININFO correctly when using custom authenticator
Confluence does not create thumbnail of an uploaded jpg image

fields.description:
On a fresh Confluence 4.0.4 installation with SQL Server as database, we found the two constraints
- cp_unique_group (cps_id, cp_type, groupname)
- cp_unique_user (cps_id, cp_type, username)

On SQL Server (not Postgres, not MySQL), this prevents the user to add more than 1 page restriction of the same type (view or edit) on the same page.
Further we failed to import a space export, which was created on a MySQL Confluence 4.0.3 installation, because of this constraint.

It seems, that you are re-introducing the same bug again, that should have been fixed under
- CONF-22374
- CONF-23040

Since we figured out the workaround, which is also describe under CONF-22374, everything works fine.

Please make sure, that this bug is permanently fixed and keep it in your regression tests.
fields.summary: Bad constraints on SQL Server

fields.description:
The com.atlassian.hibernate.HibernateObjectDao#getByClassId method calls session#get(getPersistentClass(), id).
This is prone to the same sort of ClassCastException as CONF-17657 when accidentally called with an id that actually belongs to a sibling class.  This wouldn't be the case if we upgraded to the latest version of hibernate 3, which does not suffer from https://hibernate.onjira.com/browse/HHH-1460
fields.summary: HibernateObjectDao.getByClassId() prone to ClassCastExceptions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-24026].
  {panel}

There are several related parts to this suggested improvement.

Recommendations:
1. Treat macros and all special editor objects (images, links, etc) the same - i.e. they would all have a frame.

2. Display all of the associated parameters of the object (macro, image, link, etc) as text in the header of the objects frame not a subset and not with ...

3. Allow the parameters in the frame to be edited as name value pairs and re-interpreted when focus leaves the frame.

4. Treat the text in the frame header like other text and support cursor movement in/out and through it. Include the text in searches.

Reasoning (by #):
1. Currently the new editor doesn't treat everything as equivalent.
* This results in issues with where the insertion point moves during editing, what is selected, what gets cut or pasted, etc. Treating everything special (i.e. macros, images, links - things with parameters and/or bodies) as a framed object allows everything to be treated as an object, just like a character of text.
* Providing the frame also now allows you to explicitly see what is inside and outside a special object and allows you to select the object. For example, there is currently no way to select a link. You can select text that is linked, you can select an image that is linked, but you can't select a link.

2. By displaying all parameters on all macros and special objects it becomes obvious how a page is constructed.
* Entering edit mode should expose all of the hidden information that is not visible when the page is rendered. Currently entering edit mode results in a subset of some parameters being displayed. This leads only to more confusion and requires the user to still having to enter a deeper edit mode (i.e. the macro browser or the special popups) to see the true values to edit. An edit mode within an edit mode is a huge productive hit. 
* A guiding rule should be "While in edit mode the user will be able to inspect the page and see all the properties effecting how the page renders without needing to do any further activities." If this rule was true a majority of the productivity hit of the new editor would be resolved. To do this requires displaying all of the parameters of macros and special objects in their frame. For example, a warning macro's "show icon" is not shown in the frames parameters. This means that a users must hunt and peck across many instances if he is trying to identify one needing to be change.

3. A productivity hit of the new editor is the need to enter a sub-edit mode (the macro editor or the special popups) when making a change to a parameter that is already applied to a macro or a link/image.
* Allowing the name value parameter pairs in the frame to be edited would allow rapid changes to be made with a few keystrokes with no loss of user focus caused by having to visit a dialog.
* Allowing new parameters to be added into the frame by just typing, for example "width" which is an obvious and easily remembered parameter on many macros, would allow common edits to occur quickly.
* Parameters that could not be parsed after the edit completes (i.e. after focus leaves the frame) could be handled by highlighting or in a similar way to how firebugs lets users change the parameters in the html editor window.

4. The new editor doesn't treat everything the same. All text, in the frame or body should be editable simple by moving up/down/left/right or clicking on it. If immediately above a macro then moving down or right should move you into the macro parameters. Moving to the end of the parameters and past (right arrow repeat) should take you into the body. Pressing down arrow should take you into the parameters, pressing down arrow again should move you into the body. Cut and paste should work within these areas as well as search and replace. To be productive the content, while special, needs to be treated as text.
fields.summary: Provide frames with editable parameters for macros as well as all special editor objects
Ability to grant users permissions to edit other users profiles

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-24018].
  {panel}

Currently the file extension a user specify in WebDAV Launcher configuration matters:
!http://confluence.atlassian.com/download/attachments/170494211/OCFirefoxAddOnOptions2.png?version=1&modificationDate=1226287463073!

So if a user specify an *xls* to be opened with MS Excel. Then one day the user has an a spreadsheet attachment with a filename: *xyz.XLS*, clicking on "Edit in Office" would cause nothing happen. This is due the WebDAV Launcher is case sensitive to the file extension. Would be great if we can make it case insensitive so it will just pick up the current configuration set.

h4. Workaraound
Either one of the following:
- Add another uppercased extension in the [WebDAV Launcher configuration|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Installing+the+Firefox+Add-On+for+the+Office+Connector#InstallingtheFirefoxAdd-OnfortheOfficeConnector-ConfiguringtheAdd-On]
- Rename the attachment filename extension to be lowercase.
fields.summary: Firefox WebDAV Launcher to be case insensitive on file extensions

fields.description:
When you select edit on an existing attachment link using the Editor Property Panel the Link Text field is uneditable in the Insert Link dialogue box. If you are editing a link via the Editor Properties Panel you should be able to change the Link Text.

Steps to reproduce:

1. Edit a Page
2. Select Insert -> Attachment -> Choose File
3. Upload a file and enter some link text
4. Click Save
5. Click on the inserted attachment link in the Editor and select Edit from the Property Panel
6. The Link Text field is uneditable and you are unable to change the Link Text

To then be able to change the link text you have to delete the link to the attachment, select insert attachment again, search for the file you've already uploaded and then you can enter the revised link text. Which is a bit of a kludge.
fields.summary: Link Text not editable when editing a link to an attachment

You can specify that a plugin macro has an 'attachment' parameter type. For an example see the multimedia macro.

If you try to use 'attachment' parameters in a User Macro then the Macro Browser will render the select box but it will not populate with parameters (or even shown the 'no parameters found message').

To be fair, we haven't [documented|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Guide+to+User+Macro+Templates] this type as being available to User Macros but it is [documented for plugin macros|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFDEV/Including+Information+in+your+Macro+for+the+Macro+Browser]. It should work for User Macros as well.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-24003].
  {panel}

Both JIRA and Confluence could use upgrade script improvements.

1- Migration of web.xml and server.xml files
2- Migration of extra certs and cacerts file
3- Migration of crowd.properties file
4- Choice of backup location, not just parent directory
5- Choice of starting immediately or not at all

Migration of web.xml and server.xml files
-I would have to guess that most folks run over SSL and change the keystore password (and possibly location) and therefore the default server.xml doesn't work.
-I would also have to guess that most folks up the session timeout in the web.xml and therefore the default web.xml doesn't work.

Migration of extra certs and cacerts file
-Extra certs and an updated cacerts file seems likely for most users.

Migration of crowd.properties file
-If you utilize crowd for auth, this file has to be migrated, the default file is wrong.

Choice of backup location, not just parent directory
-It is odd to backup to the parent directories, would be much better to give the user a choice.

Choice of starting immediately or not at all
-Normally I like to check things over before starting it back up.  Might be something the installer forgot (in the current state, all the above things).
fields.summary: Upgrading improvements for JIRA and Confluence (.bin script)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-24002].
  {panel}

For instances with a lot of groups, it would be helpful to allow multiple search terms during group search (e.g. while editing permissions).

For example, if I have the following groups:
* US-marketing-managers
* US-marketing-employees
* US-sales-managers
* US-sales-employees
* AUS-marketing-managers
* AUS-marketing-employees

It would be nice to be able to search for "US" and "managers" simultaneously to return all US management groups, or perhaps "marketing" and "employees" together to return all marketing employee groups. At this time searching for multiple terms yields no results.
fields.summary: Allow multiple search terms for Group Search when configuring permissions

# Create a new page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23983].
  {panel}

This bug only affects and selection and copying of the last row of a table. All other rows are fine. 

Steps to reproduce: 
# copy the last row of a table
# insert a blank row after the last row
# position the cursor in the first cell of the newly inserted row
# paste

This will cause the collective contents of last row that was copied to be all _squished_ into the first cell of the new row that was inserted.
fields.summary: Allow copy and pasting of the last row (or selections involving the last row) in webkit

fields.description:
Plugins that rely on the atl.general context and not the main context will break when used through a space that uses the documentation theme.

Since 4.0, we've supported atl.general as a cross product standard way of including resources for plugins. It seems the doctheme didn't get the memo: it is missing the relevant requireResourcesForContext in its main.vmd override.
fields.summary: Documentation Theme does not load resources for atl.general

h3. Summary of Bug

When viewing a Microsoft Excel file inside Confluence, some formatting is not rendered correctly. Examples are : 

* crossed-out words are not crossed out 
* underlines and upperlines are not displayed 
* embossed text is no longer embossed
* line breaks in cells are not respected
* Rotated cells are not respected

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Create a Excel document
# Enter formatting like underline, and strikethrough
# Insert the Excel document into Confluence
# View the file using the Viewfile macro

h3. Findings

This is how the document is supposed to look like :
!excel prob 2.png|thumbnail!

This is how the document looks like when using Viewfile macro :
!excel prob.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Excel files not rendered properly using Viewfile macro

fields.description:
The fix for CONF-23578 goes part of the way to solving double-bulleted lists in Chrome. However, doesn't account for when tinymce content events occur, such as cutting content from or pasting content in to a list.

With the exception of indent and outdent, the fix for CONF-23578 should be extended to account for tinymce content events.

fields.description:
I had a macro that was named "Macro app2" and it had one parameter.  When inserting the macro via the macro browser, I could change that parameter and all was well.  However, when trying to edit it, the popup said the macro had no parameters. 

Digging around in the JS, it is because before searching for metadata, the js takes the name and lower-cases it.  However, the metadata map that it searches contains the named in the original case.
fields.summary: Macro names can't have upper case characters

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23968].
  {panel}

*Steps to reproduce:*

# Create a Space and a page on confluence 3.5.x
# Create a separate page Confluence 4.0.x.
# Create application link between JIRA and your confluence instances
# Use the guide here to add gadget subscription of confluence pages:http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA044/Adding+a+Gadget+to+the+Directory
# Go to Administration -> System Dashboard
# Add a Gadget "Display Confluence Content" and specify the Space and Page you've created for confluence 3.5.x
# Add a Gadget "Display Confluence Content" and specify the Space and Page you've created for confluence 4.x
# You should now see your dashboard as per screenshot1:
# Logout from JIRA and navigate to the login page and you will see that the gadget from confluence 3.5.x shows a light grey container withoput any error while that of confluence 4.0.x shows an annoying 401 error. See screenshot2:

The log file though shows same stack trace but the display seems different. Here is the WARNING message thrown:

{noformat}
2011-11-24 17:49:16,382 http-8441-8 WARN anonymous 1069x1508x2 qaewzs 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /plugins/servlet/gadgets/makeRequest [http.impl.client.DefaultRequestDirector] Authentication error: Unable to respond to any of these challenges: {oauth=WWW-Authenticate: OAuth realm="http%3A%2F%2Flocalhost%3A7403%2Fconfluence"}
{noformat}

Updated:
Including the other font formatting options on this ticket that was originally just for Monospace:
* Subscript
* Superscript
* Monospace
* Clear Formatting

As there are shortcuts for italic, bold, underline and strike through formatting I would highly appreciate a shortcut for monospace.

By the way: You should use a consistent translation for "monospace". So use either "nichtproportionale Schriften" or "Festbreitenschriftart" as a German translation!

fields.description:
h4. Summary of The Bug

Internet explorer browser can't print Confluence page in more than one page. This result to Confluence page being cut in a half when IE wants to print it. The rest of the page is there, however user would need to reduce the zoom so that it could contain the whole page

Printing another site page on IE result to multiple page being able to be printed

h4. How to Replicate The Issue

# Create a page that is long enough that it would need to be printed on more than one page
# Click the "Print Preview" tool on your IE
# You would see that the page is not complete
# Reduce the zoom level to see the rest of the page
# Try to repeat the same scenario in other browser to see the difference
fields.summary: IE9 could only print Confluence into one page

fields.description:
If you connect Confluence 3.5+ to Crowd using the connector, and Crowd is backing Confluence with a delegated LDAP directory, a user that is not in the directory will always fail their first login and will not be able to authenticate until the connector syncs.

Tested in:
Confluence 3.5.13
Crowd 2.2.7
Delegated LDAP Directory pointing to Apache DS
Delegated LDAP Directory pointing to MSAD

Behavior:
User jsmith exists in LDAP, but not yet in Crowd.  User attempts to login to Confluence.  The user it told that their username or password is incorrect.  On the Crowd side, the user will be added to the directory successfully, but will continue to fail auth in Confluence until the directory sync with Crowd occurs.

This only happens when using the com.atlassian.confluence.user.ConfluenceCrowdSSOAuthenticator class.  If you are using the default Confluence authenticator class in your serap-config.xml, it works as expected.  The user jsmith will attempt to login to Confluence and will be added to Crowd and Confluence.
fields.summary: Confluence SSO authenticator class does not copy users on login

fields.description:
This affects all editing but most easily demonstrated on a code block.

*To reproduce:*

# Create a new page.
# Add an empty code block.
# Enter a few lines of text, e.g.:\\ {code}One
Two
Three
Four
Five{code}
# Position the insertion point at the start of {{Two}}.
# Press Shift+↓ twice to select lines {{Two}} and {{Three}}, including the newline between {{Three}} and {{Four}}.
# Press Ctrl+C to copy selection to clipboard.
# Press ↓ to move the insertion point at the start of {{Five}}.
# Press Ctrl+V to paste the clipboard contents.

*Expected content*

{code}
One
Two
Three
Four
Two
Three
Five
{code}

*Observed content*

{code}
One
Two
Three
Four
Two
ThreeFive
{code}
fields.summary: Pasting strips off the final newline

fields.description:
I have received notifications in german even though my personal locale is set to english.

Quoting pcurren: A similar problem was resolved for CONFDEV-3038 but looking at that fix it may be leaving around "dirty" data in the ThreadLocal for a request. So perhaps there's some issue there.
fields.summary: Notification emails get sent with the locale of the modifier

fields.description:
Keeping track of existing images: When in the editor, it is not possible to see the location of images that are displayed on the page. By location, I mean the page to which the image is attached.

This is a problem for technical documentation. Technical writers frequently reuse images by putting them in one location and then reusing them in a number of pages. It is now very labour-intensive to find out where the image came from.

-Possible workaround until this issue is fixed, though very cumbersome: The image name appears in a tooltip when you hover over the image in edit mode. The tooltip also displays the image comment. When reusing images, you could put the location (space and page name) of the image into the comment.-

There is a better workaround in my comment below.
fields.summary: In the editor it is not possible to see the location of images that are displayed on the page
Allow a node that contains a single text node consisting of white space characters to be focused / selected

fields.description:
Scenario: Delegated Authentication Directory with "Copy Groups on Login"

When a user logs in, we do N+1 LDAP queries to check for this user's groups, where N = # of groups this user is in.

This group lookup pulls in all the attributes:  This leads to a performance problem if N is very large or if each group has many members.  

It isn't necessary for us to pull in the membership attributes: it's enough for us to check for mere presence of each group: the only attribute we need to return for this purpose is the groupname attribute.
fields.summary: Group Lookup for Delegated Authentication Directory should not query for all membership attributes

fields.description:
It looks like there is a regression for this bug report:
* https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-19697

Though the previous bug report has been said to fix in Confluence 4.0 onwards, this is partially true because Edit in Word shows the linefeed properly without any problems. 

The only problem here is only after importing from Word document. Follow the steps on how to reproduce this problem based on that bug report above and take a look at this screen shot below after the Word doc import:
!Comparison_Between_WordDocImport_ViewDoc_Result.jpg|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Linefeed is not rendered properly when using Doc Import

fields.description:
When a macro throws a MacroExecutionException with some message (e.g. if the parameters are invalid, etc.) this message is not displayed on the user interface. Instead only this is displayed:
{code}
Error rendering macro 'change-report' : null
{code}

For example the macro browser preview area should show a useful error message in such cases.

Please have a look at the following stacktrace. This trace comes from the exception that is handled in com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.view.macro.ViewMacroMarshaller.marshal(MacroDefinition, ConversionContext), lines 109-132.

This exception is a UndeclaredThrowableException that wraps the MacroExecutionException, therefore the first catch block is never entered and the exception handling falls back to the "catch Throwable" block below.
The exception itself is never written to the log, I retrieved the stacktrace by debugging into this code and adding a watch expression "t.printStackTrace()"

fields.description:
Four dashes should create a Horisontal line, but this does not always happen.
Instead it insets an amount of line breaks and sometimes even tend to "remove" the "cursor".

This has been seen just under table and section elements.
fields.summary: Four dashes does not create Horizontal Line

fields.description:
The behavior of boolean parameters in xhtml macros seems quite strange.

If one adds a default value then the parameter is only inside the parameter map passed to the macro when the value is not the default value. If the actual value matches the default value, the parameter is missing from the map.
The same is true for the parameter "withoutDefault" which has the implicit default value "false" according to your documentation.

I attached a small demo project showing this. Just "atlas-debug" it, edit a page and add the "test-macro" to it. Check the preview, the macro just calls toString() on the parameter map and returns it. Check what parameters are inside the map when toggling the checkboxes for the different parameters.

Shouldn't the parameter be always inside the map with the proper value "true" or "false" regardless of the default value ?

Here is the module description of the macro:
{code}
    <xhtml-macro key="xhtml-test-macro" name="test-macro"
                 class="com.k15t.bug.demo.macro.TestMacro">
        <category name="confluence-content" />
        <parameters>
            <parameter name="trueByDefault" type="boolean" default="true" />
            <parameter name="falseByDefault" type="boolean" default="false" />
            <parameter name="withoutDefault" type="boolean" />
        </parameters>
    </xhtml-macro>
{code}
fields.summary: xhtml-macro boolean parameters with actual value = default value are not contained in the parameter map passed to the macro
Ability to send E-Mail to space administrators

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23934].
  {panel}

Could it please be a personal option what the result of typing in the following would be:

[This is a new link] But because I of habit ended it with typing "]" Confluence did not think so.

I would RARELY if ever enter a text block surrounded by "[","]" that was not meant to be a link, so it is just frustrating to me. Besides I would be use to starting and ending it with \ anyways.

But as some might the perfect solution would be to make this a personal option.

It is also highly important that https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-23884 is solved along it.

I created at least 9 out of 10 pages by adding a link before...
fields.summary: Ending Link with ] option to result in create new page link

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

* Type "the orange cat"
* keypress back and CMD+LEFT and select "orange"
* press {{CMD+i}}
* now keypress right. You will notice the cursor is at the end of the 'e' of orange (which is correct)
* Now press right again. Problem: the cursor goes back to the start of the word when it should go to the start of "cat"
fields.summary: Firefox 7.x - Highlighting text, CMD+i then keypressing right twice moves the cursor to the start of the word

fields.description:
If you create a heading with a link in the middle of it, a strange thing happens. # Create a page in a space (e.g., DOC) # Call the page "Mypage" # Add the content as denoted this wiki markup: {code}h2. A link back [Home] and all that jazz{code} # Include a TOC macro. # Save the page. The TOC macro will link the contents up to the point where the hyperlink was placed in your page's heading. It will then embed your heading's link inside the TOC link. When that embedded link closes, the rest of the heading's contents is plain, unlinked text. From my example, the TOC macro produces the following markup: will produce the following: {code:html}
  • A link back Home and all that jazz
    • {code}
fields.summary: TOC macro doesn't play nice with headings with links in them

fields.description:
If I select a chuck of text to delete, press the 'Backspace' key on my keyboard to delete it, it gets transported elsewhere on a page.

See steps 1-3 in the screenshots.

And this was the page being edited:
* http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Managing+Multiple+Dashboard+Pages
fields.summary: Deleting a selected chunk of text on a page instead moves it elsewhere on the page.
Add keyboard shortcut to quickly insert a row before or after the current row
